Template.Description: Defines constraints and extensions on the AllergyIntolerance resource for use in querying and retrieving allergy information.

Template.title: C-CDA on FHIR Care Plan
Template.Description:
CARE PLAN FRAMEWORK
A Care Plan (including Home Health Plan of Care (HHPoC)) is a consensus-driven dynamic plan that represents a patient’s and Care Team Members’ prioritized concerns, goals, and planned interventions. It serves as a blueprint shared by all Care Team Members (including the patient, their caregivers and providers), to guide the patient’s care. A Care Plan integrates multiple interventions proposed by multiple providers and disciplines for multiple conditions.
A Care Plan represents one or more Plan(s) of Care and serves to reconcile and resolve conflicts between the various Plans of Care developed for a specific patient by different providers. While both a plan of care and a care plan include the patient’s life goals and require Care Team Members (including patients) to prioritize goals and interventions, the reconciliation process becomes more complex as the number of plans of care increases. The Care Plan also serves to enable longitudinal coordination of care.
The Care Plan represents an instance of this dynamic Care Plan at a point in time. The composition itself is NOT dynamic.
Key differentiators between a Care Plan profile and CCD profile (another “snapshot in time” document):
• Requires relationships between various acts:
o Health Concerns
o Problems
o Interventions
o Goals
o Outcomes
• Provides the ability to identify patient and provider priorities with each act
• Provides a header participant to indicate occurrences of Care Plan review

Template.title: C-CDA on FHIR Consultation Note
Template.Description:
The Consultation Note is generated by a request from a clinician for an opinion or advice from another clinician. Consultations may involve face-to-face time with the patient or may fall under the auspices of telemedicine visits. Consultations may occur while the patient is inpatient or ambulatory. The Consultation Note should also be used to summarize an Emergency Room or Urgent Care encounter.
A Consultation Note includes the reason for the referral, history of present illness, physical examination, and decision-making components (Assessment and Plan).

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] id (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] meta (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] implicitRules (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] language (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] text (CONF:X-X).

MAY contain zero or more [0..*] extension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] modifierExtension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] identifier (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] date (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] type, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet ConsultDocumentType urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.11.20.9.31 DYNAMIC (CONF:2219-1320).
Constraint.Description: The Consultation Note recommends use of the code 11488-4 "Consult Note", with further specification provided by author or performer, setting, or specialty. When pre-coordinated codes are used, any coded values describing the author or performer of the service act or the practice setting must be consistent with the LOINC document type.
Constraint.Label: Consultation Note

Template.title: C-CDA on FHIR Continuity of Care Document
Template.Description:
This profile was originally based on the Continuity of Care Document (CCD) Release 1.1 which itself was derived from HITSP C32 and CCD Release 1.0.
The Continuity of Care (CCD) profile represents a core data set of the most relevant administrative, demographic, and clinical information facts about a patient's healthcare, covering one or more healthcare encounters. It provides a means for one healthcare practitioner, system, or setting to aggregate all of the pertinent data about a patient and forward it to another to support the continuity of care.
The primary use case for the CCD is to provide a snapshot in time containing the germane clinical, demographic, and administrative data for a specific patient. The key characteristic of a CCD is that the ServiceEvent is constrained to "PCPR". This means it does not function to report new ServiceEvents associated with performing care. It reports on care that has already been provided. The CCD provides a historical tally of the care over a range of time and is not a record of new services delivered.
More specific use cases, such as a Discharge Summary, Transfer Summary, Referral Note, Consultation Note, or Progress Note, are available as alternative profiles.

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] id (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] meta (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] implicitRules (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] language (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] text (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] contained (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] extension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] modifierExtension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] identifier (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] date (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] type="34133-9" (CodeSystem: LOINC urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.1) (CONF:2219-1072).
Constraint.Label: Summary of episode note

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] class (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] title (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] status (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] confidentiality (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] subject (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain at least one [1..*] author (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] attester (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] custodian (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] event (CONF:2219-1225).
Constraint.Notes:
<!-- CAS Missing CCD documentationOf/serviceEvent/performer information that was above and beyond the standard US Realm Header. (CONF:1198-8458), (CONF:1198-30882), (CONF:1198-32466), (CONF:1198-32484), (CONF:1198-32467) From C-CDA R2.1: iii. This serviceEvent SHOULD contain zero or more [0..*] performer (CONF:1198-8482). [Same as US Realm Header CONF:1198-14839] 1. The performer, if present, SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="PRF" Participation physical performer (CodeSystem: HL7ParticipationType urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.5.90 STATIC) (CONF:1198-8458). 2. The performer, if present, MAY contain zero or one [0..1] assignedEntity (CONF:1198-8459). [This is contradictory to US Realm Header CONF:1198-14841 which states "The performer, if present, SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] assignedEntity"] a. The assignedEntity, if present, SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] id (CONF:1198-30882) such that it [US Realm Header CONF:1198-14846 states "This assignedEntity SHALL contain at least one [1..*] id"] i. If this assignedEntity is an assignedPerson, the assignedEntity SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] id such that it (CONF:1198-32466). 1. SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @root="2.16.840.1.113883.4.6" National Provider Identifier (CONF:1198-32484). [US Realm Header CONF:1198-14847 states "Such ids SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] @root="2.16.840.1.113883.4.6" National Provider Identifier."] b. The assignedEntity, if present, MAY contain zero or one [0..1] assignedPerson (CONF:1198-32467).
Need extension, in original CDA mapping, it was determined this should be an extension to Composition.event (possibly in Composition.event.detail, which we may need more guidance on how best to model.) -->
Constraint.Label: serviceEvent

Constraint.NarrativeText: This event MAY contain zero or more [0..*] code="PCPR" Care Provision (CodeSystem: HL7ActClass urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.5.6) (CONF:2219-1227).
This event SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] period (CONF:2219-1226).
This period SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] start (CONF:2219-1228).
This period SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] end (CONF:2219-1229).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] encounter (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] section (CONF:2219-1049) such that it
Constraint.Label: Allergies and Intolerances Section

Template.title: C-CDA on FHIR Diagnostic Imaging
Template.Description: A Diagnostic Imaging Report (DIR) is a document that contains a consulting specialist’s interpretation of image data. It conveys the interpretation to the referring (ordering) physician and becomes part of the patient’s medical record. It is for use in Radiology, Endoscopy, Cardiology, and other imaging specialties.

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] id (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] meta (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] implicitRules (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] language (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] text (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] contained (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] extension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] modifierExtension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] identifier (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] date (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] type, which SHOULD be selected from ValueSet LOINC Imaging Document Codes urn:oid:1.3.6.1.4.1.12009.10.2.5 DYNAMIC (CONF:2219-1832).
Constraint.Description: Preferred code is 18748-4 LOINC Diagnostic Imaging Report
Constraint.Label: Diagnostic Imaging Report

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] class (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] title (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] status (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] confidentiality (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] subject (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain at least one [1..*] author (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] attester (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] custodian (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] event (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] encounter (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] section (CONF:2219-1824) such that it
Constraint.Label: Findings Section

Constraint.NarrativeText: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] title="Findings" (CONF:2219-1827).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code (CONF:2219-1836).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] text (CONF:2219-1828).
SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] section (CONF:2219-1825) such that it
Constraint.Label: DICOM Object Catalog Section - DCM 121181

Constraint.NarrativeText: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] title (CONF:2219-1829).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code="121181" (CodeSystem: DCM urn:oid:1.2.840.10008.2.16.4) (CONF:2219-1830).
Constraint.Label: Dicom Object Catalog

Constraint.NarrativeText: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] text (CONF:2219-1831).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] section (CONF:2219-1826) such that it
SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] title (CONF:2219-1833).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code, which SHOULD be selected from ValueSet DIRSectionTypeCodes urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.11.20.9.59 DYNAMIC (CONF:2219-1834).
Constraint.Description: The section/code SHOULD be selected from LOINC or DICOM for sections not listed in the DIR Section Type Codes table

Constraint.NarrativeText: SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] text (CONF:2219-1835).

The trachea is midline. The previously described opacity at the medial right lung base has cleared. There are no new infiltrates. There is a new round density at the left hilus, superiorly (diameter about 45mm). A CT scan is recommended for further evaluation. The pleural spaces are clear. The visualized musculoskeletal structures and the upper abdomen are stable and unremarkable.</p> </div> </text> </section> <section> <title value="DICOM Object Catalog Section"/> <code> <coding> <system value="urn:oid:1.2.840.10008.2.16.4"/> <code value="121181"/> <display value="DICOM Object Catalog"/> </coding> </code> <text> <status value="generated"/> <div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"> <p>Computed Radiography Image Storage</p> </div> </text> </section> <section> <title value="Indications for Procedure Section"/> <code> <coding> <system value="urn:oid:1.2.840.10008.2.16.4"/> <code value="121109"/> <display value="Indications for Procedure"/> </coding> </code> <text> <status value="generated"/> <div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"> <p>Suspected lung tumor</p> </div> </text> </section> </Composition>

Template.title: C-CDA on FHIR Discharge Summary
Template.Description:
The Discharge Summary is a document which synopsizes a patient's admission to a hospital, LTPAC provider, or other setting. It provides information for the continuation of care following discharge. The Joint Commission requires the following information to be included in the Discharge Summary (http://www.jointcommission.org/):
• The reason for hospitalization (the admission)
• The procedures performed, as applicable
• The care, treatment, and services provided
• The patient’s condition and disposition at discharge
• Information provided to the patient and family
• Provisions for follow-up care
The best practice for a Discharge Summary is to include the discharge disposition in the display of the header.

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] id (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] meta (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] implicitRules (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] language (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] text (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] contained (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] extension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] modifierExtension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] identifier (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] date (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] type, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet DischargeSummaryDocumentTypeCode urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.11.20.4.1 DYNAMIC (CONF:2219-1208).
Constraint.Description: The Discharge Summary recommends use of a single document type code, 18842-5 "Discharge summary", with further specification provided by author or performer, setting, or specialty. When pre-coordinated codes are used, any coded values describing the author or performer of the service act or the practice setting must be consistent with the LOINC document type.

Template.title: C-CDA on FHIR History and Physical
Template.Description:
A History and Physical (H&P) note is a medical report that documents the current and past conditions of the patient. It contains essential information that helps determine an individual's health status.
The first portion of the report is a current collection of organized information unique to an individual. This is typically supplied by the patient or the caregiver, concerning the current medical problem or the reason for the patient encounter. This information is followed by a description of any past or ongoing medical issues, including current medications and allergies. Information is also obtained about the patient's lifestyle, habits, and diseases among family members. The next portion of the report contains information obtained by physically examining the patient and gathering diagnostic information in the form of laboratory tests, imaging, or other diagnostic procedures.
The report ends with the clinician's assessment of the patient's situation and the intended plan to address those issues.
A History and Physical Examination is required upon hospital admission as well as before operative procedures. An initial evaluation in an ambulatory setting is often documented in the form of an H&P note.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] meta (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] implicitRules (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] language (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] text (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] contained (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] extension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] modifierExtension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] identifier (CONF:X-X).

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] type, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet HPDocumentType urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20.22 DYNAMIC (CONF:2219-1820).
Constraint.Description: The H&P Note recommends use of a single document type code, 34117-2 "History and physical note", with further specification provided by author or performer, setting, or specialty. When pre-coordinated codes are used, any coded values describing the author or performer of the service act or the practice setting must be consistent with the LOINC document type.

Template.title: C-CDA on FHIR Operative Note
Template.Description:
The Operative Note is a frequently used type of procedure note with specific requirements set forth by regulatory agencies.
The Operative Note is created immediately following a surgical or other high-risk procedure. It records the pre- and post-surgical diagnosis, pertinent events of the procedure, as well as the condition of the patient following the procedure. The report should be sufficiently detailed to support the diagnoses, justify the treatment, document the course of the procedure, and provide continuity of care.

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] id (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] meta (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] implicitRules (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] language (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] text (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] contained (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] extension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] modifierExtension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] identifier (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] date (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] type, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet SurgicalOperationNoteDocumentTypeCode urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.11.20.1.1 DYNAMIC (CONF:2219-1888).
Constraint.Description: The Operative Note recommends use of a single document type code, 11504-8 "Provider-unspecified Operation Note", with further specification provided by author or performer, setting, or specialty data. Some of the LOINC codes in the Surgical Operation Note Document Type Code table are pre-coordinated with the practice setting or the training or professional level of the author. Use of pre-coordinated codes is not recommended because of potential conflict with other information in the header. When these codes are used, any coded values describing the author or performer of the service act or the practice setting must be consistent with the LOINC document type.

Template.title: C-CDA on FHIR Procedure Note
Template.Description:
A Procedure Note encompasses many types of non-operative procedures including interventional cardiology, gastrointestinal endoscopy, osteopathic manipulation, and many other specialty fields. Procedure Notes are differentiated from Operative Notes because they do not involve incision or excision as the primary act.
The Procedure Note is created immediately following a non-operative procedure. It records the indications for the procedure and, when applicable, postprocedure diagnosis, pertinent events of the procedure, and the patient’s tolerance for the procedure. It should be detailed enough to justify the procedure, describe the course of the procedure, and provide continuity of care.

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] id (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] meta (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] implicitRules (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] language (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] text (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] contained (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] extension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] modifierExtension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] identifier (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] date (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] type, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet ProcedureNoteDocumentTypeCodes urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.11.20.6.1 DYNAMIC (CONF:2219-1604).
Constraint.Description: The Procedure Note recommends use of a single document type code, 28570-0 "Procedure Note", with further specification provided by author or performer, setting, or specialty. When pre-coordinated codes are used, any coded values describing the author or performer of the service act or the practice setting must be consistent with the LOINC document type.
Constraint.Label: Procedure Note

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] class (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] title (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] status (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] confidentiality (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] subject (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain at least one [1..*] author (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] attester (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] custodian (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain at least one [1..*] event (CONF:2219-1605).
Constraint.Description: A serviceEvent is required in the Procedure Note to represent the main act, such as a colonoscopy or a cardiac stress study, being documented. It must be equivalent to or further specialize the value inherent in the composition.type (such as where the composition.type is simply "Procedure Note" and the procedure is "colonoscopy"), and it shall not conflict with the value inherent in the composition.type, as such a conflict would create ambiguity. Event.period indicates the time the actual event (as opposed to the encounter surrounding the event) took place. If the duration is unknown, the appropriate HL7 null value such as "NI" or "NA" must be used.
Constraint.Label: serviceEvent

Template.title: C-CDA on FHIR Progress Note
Template.Description:
This profile represents a patient’s clinical status during a hospitalization, outpatient visit, treatment with a LTPAC provider, or other healthcare encounter.
Taber’s medical dictionary defines a Progress Note as “An ongoing record of a patient's illness and treatment. Physicians, nurses, consultants, and therapists record their notes concerning the progress or lack of progress made by the patient between the time of the previous note and the most recent note.”
Mosby’s medical dictionary defines a Progress Note as “Notes made by a nurse, physician, social worker, physical therapist, and other health care professionals that describe the patient's condition and the treatment given or planned.”
A Progress Note is not a re-evaluation note. A Progress Note is not intended to be a Progress Report for Medicare. Medicare B Section 1833(e) defines the requirements of a Medicare Progress Report.

MAY contain zero or more [0..*] extension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] modifierExtension (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] identifier (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] date (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] type, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet ProgressNoteDocumentTypeCode urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.11.20.8.1 DYNAMIC (CONF:2219-1960).
Constraint.Description: The Progress Note recommends use of a single document type code, 11506-3 "Subsequent evaluation note", with further specification provided by author or performer, setting, or specialty. When pre-coordinated codes are used, any coded values describing the author or performer of the service act or the practice setting must be consistent with the LOINC document type.

Template.title: C-CDA on FHIR Referral Note
Template.Description:
A Referral Note communicates pertinent information from a provider who is requesting services of another provider of clinical or non-clinical services. The information in this document includes the reason for the referral and additional information that would augment decision making and care delivery.
Examples of referral situations are when a patient is referred from a family physician to a cardiologist for cardiac evaluation or when patient is sent by a cardiologist to an emergency department for angina or when a patient is referred by a nurse practitioner to an audiologist for hearing screening or when a patient is referred by a hospitalist to social services.

Template.title: C-CDA on FHIR US Realm Header
Template.Description: This profile defines constraints that represent common administrative and demographic concepts for US Realm clinical documents. Further specification, such as type, are provided in document profiles that conform to this profile.

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] id (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] meta (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] implicitRules (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] language (CONF:2219-146).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] text (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] contained (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] C-CDA on FHIR Data Enterer (identifier: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ccda-data-enterer-extension) (CONF:2219-1844).
Constraint.Description: The dataEnterer represents the person who transferred the content, written or dictated, into the clinical document. To clarify, an author provides the content found within the header or body of a document, subject to their own interpretation; a dataEnterer adds an author's information to the electronic system.
Constraint.Label: dataEnterer

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or more [0..*] C-CDA on FHIR Informant (identifier: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ccda-informant-extension) (CONF:2219-1849).
Constraint.Description: The informant describes an information source for any content within the clinical document. This informant is constrained for use when the source of information is an assigned health care provider for the patient.
Constraint.Label: informant

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or more [0..*] C-CDA on FHIR Information Recipient (identifier: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ccda-information-recipient-extension) (CONF:2219-1856).
Constraint.Description: The informationRecipient records the intended recipient of the information at the time the document was created. In cases where the intended recipient of the document is the patient's health chart, set the receivedOrganization to the scoping organization for that chart.
Constraint.Label: informationRecipient

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or more [0..*] C-CDA on FHIR Participant (identifier: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ccda-participant-extension) (CONF:2219-1861).
Constraint.Description:
The participant identifies supporting entities, including parents, relatives, caregivers, insurance policyholders, guarantors, and others related in some way to the patient.
A supporting person or organization is an individual or an organization with a relationship to the patient. A supporting person who is playing multiple roles would be recorded in multiple participants (e.g., emergency contact and next-of-kin).
Constraint.Label: participant

Constraint.NarrativeText: SHOULD contain zero or more [0..*] C-CDA on FHIR Performer (identifier: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ccda-performer-extension) (CONF:2219-1869).
Constraint.Description: The performer participant represents clinicians who actually and principally carry out the serviceEvent. In a transfer of care this represents the healthcare providers involved in the current or pertinent historical care of the patient. Preferably, the patient’s key healthcare care team members would be listed, particularly their primary physician and any active consulting physicians, therapists, and counselors.
Constraint.Label: performer

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or more [0..*] C-CDA on FHIR Authorization (identifier: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ccda-authorization-extension) (CONF:2219-2012).
Constraint.Description: The performer participant represents clinicians who actually and principally carry out the serviceEvent. In a transfer of care this represents the healthcare providers involved in the current or pertinent historical care of the patient. Preferably, the patient’s key healthcare care team members would be listed, particularly their primary physician and any active consulting physicians, therapists, and counselors.
Constraint.Label: performer

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or more [0..*] modifierExtension (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] identifier (CONF:2219-147).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] date (CONF:2219-148).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] type (CONF:2219-149).
Constraint.Label: Document Type

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] class (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] title (CONF:2219-150).
Constraint.Label: Document Title

Constraint.NarrativeText: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] status (CONF:2219-1048).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] confidentiality, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet HL7 BasicConfidentialityKind urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16926 STATIC (CONF:2219-151).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] U.S. DAF Patient Profile (identifier: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/daf-patient) (CONF:2219-152).

Template.title: C-CDA on FHIR Consent
Template.Description:
This profile represents information about the patient’s consent.
The type of consent is conveyed in type. Consents in the header have been finalized and should be on file. This specification does not address how 'Privacy Consent' is represented, but does not preclude the inclusion of ‘Privacy Consent’.
The authorization consent is used for referring to consents that are documented elsewhere in the EHR or medical record for a health condition and/or treatment that is described in the document.

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] id (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] meta (CONF:X-X).

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] applies (CONF:X-X).

MAY contain zero or more [0..*] topic (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] authority (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] domain (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] type="CONS" (CodeSystem: HL7ActClass urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.5.6) (CONF:2219-2008).

Template.title: U.S. DAF Organization Profile
Template.Description: Defines basic constraints and extensions on the Organization resource for use with other DAF resources

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] id (CONF:X-X).

SHOULD contain zero or more [0..*] telecom (CONF:2219-67).
SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] address (CONF:2219-63).

The address, if present, SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] state (CONF:2219-70).

Template.Sample: <Organization xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir"> <id value="hl7"/> <!-- Organization.active is optional in FHIR DSTU2 and SHOULD in Trifolia http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/daf-organization - have added the default value of "true" --> <active value="true"/> <name value="Community Health and Hospitals"/> <telecom> <system value="phone"/> <value value="(+1) 555-555-1002"/> </telecom> <telecom> <system value="fax"/> <value value="(+1) 555-555-1005"/> </telecom> <address> <line value="1002 Healthcare Drive"/> <city value="Portland"/> <state value="OR"/> <postalCode value="99123"/> <country value="USA"/> </address> </Organization>

Template.title: U.S. DAF Patient Profile
Template.Description: Defines constraints and extensions on the patient resource for use in querying and retrieving patient demographic information.

Constraint.NarrativeText: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] id (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] meta (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] implicitRules (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] language (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] text (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] contained (CONF:X-X).
SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] extension (CONF:2219-6).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] modifierExtension (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain at least one [1..*] identifier (CONF:2219-1).
Such identifiers SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] type (CONF:2219-7).
Such identifiers SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] system (CONF:2219-8).
Such identifiers SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] value (CONF:2219-9).
SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] active (CONF:2219-10).
SHOULD contain zero or more [0..*] name (CONF:2219-11).
SHOULD contain zero or more [0..*] telecom (CONF:2219-2).
The telecom, if present, SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] system (CONF:2219-12).
The telecom, if present, SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] value (CONF:2219-13).
The telecom, if present, SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] use (CONF:2219-14).
SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] gender (CONF:2219-15).
SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] birthDate (CONF:2219-16).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] deceasedBoolean (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] deceasedDateTime (CONF:X-X).
SHOULD contain zero or more [0..*] address (CONF:2219-3).
The address, if present, SHALL contain at least one [1..*] line (CONF:2219-18).
The address, if present, SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] city (CONF:2219-19).
The address, if present, SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] state (CONF:2219-20).
The address, if present, SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] postalCode (CONF:2219-21).
The address, if present, SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] country (CONF:2219-22).
SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] maritalStatus (CONF:2219-23).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] multipleBirthBoolean (CONF:X-X).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] multipleBirthInteger (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] photo (CONF:X-X).
SHOULD contain zero or more [0..*] contact (CONF:2219-4).
The contact, if present, SHOULD contain zero or more [0..*] address (CONF:2219-5).
The address, if present, SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] use (CONF:2219-28).
The address, if present, SHOULD contain zero or more [0..*] line (CONF:2219-29).
The address, if present, SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] city (CONF:2219-30).
The address, if present, SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] state (CONF:2219-31).
The address, if present, SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] postalCode (CONF:2219-32).
The address, if present, SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] country (CONF:2219-33).
The contact, if present, SHOULD contain zero or more [0..*] relationship (CONF:2219-25).
The contact, if present, SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] name (CONF:2219-26).
The contact, if present, SHOULD contain zero or more [0..*] telecom (CONF:2219-27).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] animal (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] communication (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] generalPractitioner (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or one [0..1] managingOrganization (CONF:X-X).
MAY contain zero or more [0..*] link (CONF:X-X).

Template.Sample: <Patient xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir"> <id value="example"/> <!-- MRN --> <identifier> <!-- <use value="usual"/>--> <type> <coding> <system value="http://hl7.org/fhir/v2/0203"/> <code value="MR"/> </coding> </type> <system value="http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/daf-patient"/> <value value="12345"/> <period> <start value="2016-01-08"/> </period> </identifier> <active value="true"/> <name> <use value="official"/> <family value="Jones"/> <given value="Henry"/> </name> <telecom> <system value="phone"/> <value value="(360) 555 1212"/> <use value="home"/> </telecom> <telecom> <system value="phone"/> <value value="(360) 444 1212"/> <use value="work"/> </telecom> <!-- use FHIR code system for male / female --> <gender value="male"/> <birthDate value="1985-08-25"></birthDate> <deceasedBoolean value="false"/> <address> <!--<use value="home"/>--> <line value="534 Anywhere St"/> <city value="Tomorrowland"/> <!-- patient.address.city, state, postal code and country are required in FHIR DSTU2 (1...1), but all SHOULD constraints in Trifolia http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/daf-patient - is this correct? --> <state value="WA"/> <postalCode value="98001"/> <country value="US"/> </address> <maritalStatus> <coding> <system value="http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/MaritalStatus"/> <code value="M"/> <display value="Married"/> </coding> </maritalStatus> <multipleBirthBoolean value="true"/> <contact> <relationship> <coding> <system value="http://hl7.org/fhir/patient-contact-relationship"/> <code value="family"/> </coding> </relationship> <name> <family value="Phire"/> <given value="De-Estu-Too"/> </name> <telecom> <system value="phone"/> <value value="(360) 666-1212"/> </telecom> <address> <!--<use value="home"/>--> <line value="534 Anywhere St"/> <city value="Tomorrowland"/> <state value="WA"/> <postalCode value="98001"/> <country value="US"/> </address> <!--<gender value="female"/>--> </contact> </Patient>
